conclusion: Understand the flow of liquid through the baffles to determine which container the liquid will flow into.
The image shows liquid flowing from points A, B, and C through the baffles.
The baffles are designed to guide the liquid in specific directions.
The baffles are arranged to direct the liquid flow.
Liquid from A, B, and C will be guided by the baffles to either container D or E.
Liquid from A is directed by the baffle to flow into container D.
Liquid from B is directed by the baffle to flow into container D.
Liquid from C is directed by the baffle to flow into container E.
The liquid from A and B will flow into container D.
The liquid from C will flow into container E.
